record.field: 1. Which share had the largest difference between highest and lowest price over the last 12 months?
2. What was yesterday’s cost difference between 50 shares in Fevs plc and 100 shares in Steapars?
3. Today’s Drebs Ltd share price represents a 40% increase on the price one month ago. What was the Drebs Ltd share price a month ago?
4. If a driver travels an average of 4,250 miles per month driving only along motorways in an Xtam car, what is the predicted annual consumption of fuel (in gallons)?
5. A car dealership has £600,000 to spend and wants to buy equal numbers of the Taber and Ursa cars. What is the largest number of each type of car that can be ordered?
6. What is the ratio of the cost of a Taber: Velvo: Xtam?
7. Which of the countries shown experienced the largest percentage increase in public transport spending from 2007 to 2008?
8. For years 1 to 3 inclusive, by how much did Make Fit Ltd’s income from consultancy services differ from those of Pure Gap plc?
9. Which of the following statements is false regarding legal sector spending between Year 4 and projected Year 5?
A. IT consulting will increase by £5million
B. IT consulting will match that of year 2
C. IT software will exceed IT consulting
D. Spending on IT hardware will decline
10. In which year(s) did Make Fit Ltd and Pure Gap plc’s combined IT consultancy income exceed £6million?
11. Two number are in the ratio 3 : 5. If 9 is subtracted from each, the new numbers are in the ratio 12 : 23. The smaller number is :
12. A and B together have Sterling 1210. If 4/15 of A's amount is equal to 2/5 of B's amount, how much amount does B have?
13. Two numbers are respectively 20% and 50% more than a third number. The ratio of the two numbers is :
14. A sum of money is to be distributed among A, B, C, D in the proportion of 5 : 2 : 4 : 3. If C gets Euro 1000 more than D, what is B's share?

15. Seats for Mathematics, Physics and Biology in a school are in the ratio 5 : 7 : 8. There is a proposal to increase these seats by 40%, 50% and 75% respectively. What will be the ratio of increased seats?
16. In a mixture 60 litres, the ratio of milk and water 2 : 1. If the this ratio is to be 1 : 2, then the quanity of water to be further added is :
17. The ratio of the number of boys and girls in a college is 7 : 8. If the percentage increase in the number of boys and girls be 20% and 10% respectively, what will be the new ratio?
18. If 0.75 : x :: 5 : 8, then x is equal to:
19. The sum of three numbers is 98. If the ratio of the first to second is 2 :3 and that of the second to the third is 5 : 8, then the second number is :
20. The salaries A, B, C are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5. If the increments of 15%, 10% and 20% are allowed respectively in their salaries, then what will be new ratio of their salaries?
21. If 40% of a number is equal to two-third of another number, what is the ratio of first number to the second number?
22. Two number are in the ratio 3 : 5. If 9 is subtracted from each, the new numbers are in the ratio 12 : 23. The smaller number is :
23. Which company has the highest annual profit per employee?
24. If the profits per employee remain the same, how many extra employees would Company B have to recruit to achieve annual profits of £39,000?
25. If every employee of Company D contributes equally, how much would each employee have to contribute in order to collectively buy Company A?
26. Approximately what percentage of the people sampled are unemployed?

27. If it is predicted that the number of females employed in IT will rise by 10% every year, but the number of males stays the same, what percent of IT employees would be female after a three year period ?
28. What was the average accident cost per vehicle on the road in Ribley in November?
29. Comparing Wartop with Surren, what was the difference in average accident cost per vehicle on the road in October?
30. The only towns in the County are Ribley, Wartop and Surren. What was the average accident cost per vehicle on the road in September for the County?
